titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Betsy Pittman.

address.addressline: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Betsy Pittman in February 2006.

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.repository: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Center.
did.abstract: In the late 1960s, the University experienced significant changes, disruption and unrest among the faculty and student body. The white paper provides some documentation and background for this period.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: In the late 1960s, the University experienced significant changes, disruption and unrest among the faculty and student body. The white paper proves some documentation and background for this period.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains the white paper "The Continuing Crisis at UConn" and background materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged as received.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to the University, its history, administration, faculty, staff and students. Additional information on Student Movements may also be found in the Alternative Press Collection. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This record series is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on this collection.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], Crisis at UConn Collection. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were donated by Diane Cox in 2004.

did.unittitle: "The Continuing Crisis at UConn: A White Paper,"
